public_information: We need to schedule a meeting on Monday during work hours from 09:00 to 17:00
All participants must attend: Noah, Teresa, Bradley, Philip, Joyce, Ryan, Aaron
Each participant has existing busy intervals that must not be overlapped
Find a time slot of 30 minutes within work hours on Monday that is free for all participants

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL targeted for the FastDownward solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that can be consumed by FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is noah. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->noah->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->noah->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file for FastDownward to represent your availability and the meeting scheduling constraints. If some information is missing do not make assumptions, only encode what you know. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL targeted for the FastDownward solver. You always provide a combined PDDL domain and a combined PDDL problem file that can be consumed by FastDownward. Enclose the combined PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the combined PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents keep their actions and predicates distinct by using agent specific predicates or action names.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. There are seven participant agents that each provide PDDL fragments describing their availability and constraints. Your goal is to integrate these PDDL fragments and produce a unified PDDL domain and PDDL problem for FastDownward that schedules a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants. Keep in mind that the PDDL fragments you receive may be partial or use different names for the same concept. Maintain distinct actions or predicates for each agent when appropriate. Here is the goal to achieve: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Here is the information from the participants: {pddl_noah} {pddl_teresa} {pddl_bradley} {pddl_philip} {pddl_joyce} {pddl_ryan} {pddl_aaron} Think step by step and provide a unified PDDL domain and a unified PDDL problem file for FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
